channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Aerial mapper Nick Channon heads home after dodging Australian fires, Covid-19
item.description: First wildfires, then Covid-19. Aerial mapper, photographer and artist Nick Channon is finally home after his Australian job stretched from three months to seven.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates for 17 May
item.description: The eighth weekly survey on the impact Covid-19 is having on Kiwis' lives found people were simply looking forward to having more freedom heading into alert level two.

item.title: Two more fires at cellphone towers, adding to series of suspected attacks
item.description: Police are investigating the fires in the Auckland suburbs of Weymouth and Clendon, which happened about 11pm last night.

item.title: Coal mine defends plan to expand as enivronmental groups raise concerns
item.description: Coal miner Bathurst Resources is defending its plans to expand its Canterbury Coal Mine into another 18 hectares of forest, farms, and wetland.

item.title: Art gallery launches new exhibition - online
item.description: The Auckland Art Gallery is launching a digital exhibition on its website, so people can peer behind its closed doors.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand and around the world on 16 May
item.description: It's the first weekend at level 2 and many malls, restaurants, cafes and cinemas have reopened as New Zealanders burst their bubbles.

item.title: No restrictions on numbers when skifields open
item.description: Skifield operators will not be restricted in how many skiers they have on the slopes under Covid-19 Level 2 rules this season.

item.title: Two dead after fatal crash on SH5
item.description: Two people have died following a crash in Hawke's Bay this afternoon.

item.title: Covid-19: Green light for sex industry to restart
item.description: Some clients of sex workers have been "difficult" about the industry being shut during lockdown, the Prostitutes Collective says.

item.title: Another cell phone tower attacked in Wellington
item.description: An investigation is underway following another suspicious fire near a cell phone tower in Wellington.

item.title: Police still seeking backpack as dead man named
item.description: The man whose body was found in the water at Evans Bay in Wellington on Tuesday has been identified.

item.title: Cliff rescue under way in Bay of Plenty
item.description: Emergency services are trying to airlift a man off a cliff near the river mouth in Whakatāne.

item.title: Back to zero: No new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand reported today
item.description: New Zealand has recorded no new cases of Covid-19 in the past 24 hours, the Health Ministry has confirmed.

item.title: Auckland water restrictions begin, but will be costly for some
item.description: Auckland water restrictions began today, in response to the drought in the area. But a property maintenance business says they could put jobs at risk.

item.title: As it happened: Live updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: Many malls, restaurants, cafes and cinemas are now open under level 2, but there are still many rules to adhere to. See how the day's Covid-19 news unfolded with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Glimmer of hope for tourism as NZers plan domestic holidays - survey
item.description: A survey out today shows more than one million New Zealanders plan to take a domestic holiday in the next seven to 12 months.

item.title: Man charged with murder after body found in Te Anau
item.description: A man has been charged with murder following the discovery of a woman's body at an address in Te Anau.

item.title: Budget 2020: What you need to know
item.description: The government has unveiled a $50 billion recovery package as part of today's Budget. Here's a breakdown of where Budget 2020's money is going.
